dt: {bc}a place where ships may ride secure from storms {bc}{sx|haven||}
{bc}a harbor town or city where ships may take on or discharge cargo

et: Middle English, from Old English & Anglo-French, from Latin {it}portus{/it} {ma}{mat|ford|}{/ma}
shortdef: a place where ships may ride secure from storms : haven
a harbor town or city where ships may take on or discharge cargo

dt: {bc}an opening (as in a valve seat or valve face) for intake or exhaust of a fluid
{bc}the area of opening in a cylinder face of a passageway for the working fluid in an engine
{bc}a small opening in a container or vessel especially for viewing or for the controlled passage of material
{bc}an opening in a vessel's side (as for admitting light or loading cargo)
{bc}a hole in an armored vehicle or fortification through which guns may be fired
{bc}a hardware interface by which a computer is connected to another device (such as a printer, a mouse, or another computer)

et: Middle English {it}porte{/it}, from Anglo-French, gate, door, from Latin {it}porta{/it} passage, gate; akin to Latin {it}portus{/it} port
shortdef: an opening (as in a valve seat or valve face) for intake or exhaust of a fluid
the area of opening in a cylinder face of a passageway for the working fluid in an engine; also : such a passageway

dt: {bc}the position in which a military weapon is carried at the command {it}port arms{/it}

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from {it}porter{/it} to carry, from Latin {it}portare{/it}
shortdef: the position in which a military weapon is carried at the command port arms

dt: {bc}to turn or put (a helm) to the left

shortdef: to turn or put (a helm) to the left —used chiefly as a command

dt: {bc}the left side of a ship or aircraft looking forward

shortdef: the left side of a ship or aircraft looking forward —called also larboard

dt: {bc}located on the left side of a ship or airplane looking forward {bc}of, relating to, or situated to {d_link|port|port:5}

dt.t: The forward and {wi}port{/wi} staterooms share a head and both feature upper/lower bunks.

shortdef: located on the left side of a ship or airplane looking forward : of, relating to, or situated to port

dt: {bc}a sweet fortified wine of rich taste and aroma made in Portugal

shortdef: a sweet fortified wine of rich taste and aroma made in Portugal; also : a similar wine made elsewhere

dt: {bc}to translate (software) into a version for another computer or operating system

shortdef: to translate (software) into a version for another computer or operating system
